item.title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.  The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

 

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;  master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation  requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

 

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

 

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business  rules profiling

Performs data  quality  assessment and quality  metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

 

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

 

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

 

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

 

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or  Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

 

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

 

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations. 

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

 

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Expert Cloud Data Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

CN Customer & Innovation Engine is seeking a Senior Data Architect to drive strategic innovation and modernization initiatives and architecture practices of the innovation group. As a data stacks architect, you will lead the architecture of cloud native APIs, DataHubs, DataLake Information models and cloud infrastructures to drive the creation industry leading applications, BI and AI. As an expert product builder, you will define practical architectures that ensure the performance, scalability, and maintainability of complex distributed systems. You will also contribute to the definition of strategic technology directions and define continuous improvement objectives in collaboration with Innovation leadership team.

Main Responsibilities


·       Lead the delivery of innovation initiatives and create great products by focusing on the needs of our customers and business value delivery.

·       Lead modern data architecture best practices including Domain Driven Design and Analytical data models.

·       Create systems architectures and modernization strategies; moving to cloud native applications, APIs, MicroServices, Data Lake, BI and AI with target and transitions architectures and Roadmaps over multiple years.

·       Design and optimize application and integration strategies for the cost-effective delivery of scalable and reliable distributed systems.

·       Evaluate current and emerging Data, Analytics and AI technologies

·       Be a leader in the architecture and engineering group, fostering a culture of design thinking, brainstorming,  efficiency, and balancing vision with practicality.

·       Define architecture and engineering standards, patterns & best practices.

·       Influence leadership with effective communication of proposals, directions and strategic decision making.

Working Conditions

-        Work from home

-        Occasional travel

Requirements

Experience

·       12+ years of experience with data engineering and architecture for API, applications, analytics BI and AI.

·       5+ years of experience as an Architect with application, technology architecture covering Applications, APIs, MicroServices, Integration, BI, Analytics and AI.

·       3+ years of experience as Senior Architect using cloud native data architecture and technologies.

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s degree in technology related field or equivalent experience

 

Competencies

·       Leadership

·       Communication

·       Time management

·       Business Acumen

Technical Skills/Knowledge

  • Strong Experience engineering, architecting, and delivering enterprise grade products
  • Strong Experience with Information and Data Architecture patterns
  • Strong Experience managing BI Frameworks, design principles, and standards
  • Good understanding of Data Governance and Data Lineage and technologies.
  • Experience implementing Big Data, Pipelines and Data Warehouse Architectures
  • Experience with data architecture for Cloud Native Application and APIs
  • Cloud Data Services Architecture knowledge is an asset

o   Experience architecting/operating solutions build on Azure, GCP, others

§  DevOps knowledge is an asset

o   Experience working with DevOps, CI/CD/CT – Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitLab

o   Experience with Test Automation, TDD, BDD, ATDD

§  Experience with AI/ML technologies is an asset

§  Experience in program & project scoping and planning with Agile process and tools

§  Experience in delivering agile and iterative architectures

§  Experience with Legacy Systems Modernization (Mainframe, SAP, Java) is a plus

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

item.title: Expert, Network Security Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The purpose of this role is to evaluate network solutions, configurations, and designs against security requirements, and define cybersecurity reference architectures and standards for all network environments at CN.

Main Responsibilities

Network Security Architecture Practice 

  • Put in place the proper sets of network security architecture controls to manage safety and security risk while enabling the business for technology systems such as: service-oriented-architectures; cloud technologies and containers; advanced analytics; AI; Industrial IoT;, networking infrastructure; mobile technologies; etc.
  • Ensure the network security architecture is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented.
  • Maintain and build relevant, current, valid and reliable team knowledge related to network security architecture.
  • Facilitate key decisions involving network architecture and technologies.
  • Advance security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members.
  • Ensure the full documentation of security designs, as built architectures and operational processes through clear diagrams and well-written documents.

Network Security Roadmap and Strategy

  • Collaborate with the CISO, Sr Mgr Network Security Architecture, cybersecurity team, portfolio managers, other architects, and I&T leadership to understand the business direction and consequent impact on the security posture. 
  • Define the proper course of action and investment strategy by building business cases and security roadmaps.
  • Engage the network security vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities and limitations to drive improvements in the security posture of current products, and assist in the selection of the right partners.
  • Continuously monitor and evaluate the environment through self-assessments and independent security reviews. Enable management to identify deficiencies and inefficiencies and to initiate improvement actions though security roadmap and strategies.

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, System Analysis or other relevant field
  • At least one recognized network security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED), Cisco Certified Internetworking Expert (CCIE) – Security, Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Engineer (PCNSE), etc.
  • Architecture related certifications (TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP-ISSAP, etc.) preferred

Skills/Knowledge

  • Ability to define and organise an architecture security apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc;
  • Demonstrated capability to understand the security implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement;
  • Strong knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems;
  • Proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution in large, geographically dispersed organizations with 24/7 operations;
  • Strong knowledge of the technologies and architecture principles required to secure complex network environments such as: 802.1X, Cisco ISE, packet capture and analysis, NetFlow, SFlow, NGFW, Zero Trust, VPN, VLANs, IDS, IPS, ACLs, device authentication, network behavior anomaly detection, SOAR, firewall configuration management, DDoS protection, etc;
  • Deep understanding of network protocols and standard approaches for network segmentation.
  • Ability to derive security requirements from vaguely formulated business needs;
  • Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation;
  • Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment;
  • Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. NIST, ISO 27001, OWASP;

Experience 

  • Minimum 12 years overall IT work experience 
  • Minimum 8 years network security experience 
  • Minimum 5 years experience in network security architecture

Assets (if applicable)

  • Virtual appliance configuration experience
  • Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies 
  • Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults , Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc.
  • In depth understanding of infrastructure and network architecture and design, LAN/WAN implementation, and Windows/Linux environments
  • Deep knowledge of security foundations: cryptography, Root of Trust, security models, etc. 
  • Railroad, transportation, or Global industrial experience is a significant plus

Working Conditions 

Occasional business travel (Canada and US) in accordance with CN policy 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email. 

Effective November 1, 2021,CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition ofemployment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of ourwholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents andsuppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Senior Automated Test Developer, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

How do you picture an insurance company? And its work environment? We bet you’d be in for a surprise if you dropped by the Data Lab!

The Intact Lab – Data Science is a data science innovation laboratory. 

A leading edge #insuretech team where data scientists, actuaries, machine learning experts, a meteorologist and software engineers work hand in hand.

Their shared goal? Develop and implement innovative solutions and shape the insurance industry’s future in the data age by tapping into Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning.

Merging the intimacy and speed of a startup with the resources of a large corporation, the Intact Lab – Data Science is an energized environment offering exciting challenges, inspiring colleagues, and a dynamic career at one of Canada’s top 100 employers!

Do you want to use AI to generate innovative solutions that bring clear tangible value to your organization?

Do you like building solutions in an agile environment? Do you want to have a strong impact on the AI and Machine Learning vision of Canada’s largest insurance company? We have the perfect opportunity for you!

Your mission :

In an Agile project approach, perform various tasks to test and analyze technical application components of the AI Engineering department, which includes artificial intelligence models, with the aim of improving systems, workflow and the profitability. You will also be required to work on the development of automated tests between the different platforms. The degree of complexity can vary throughout the life cycle of projects. Depending on the scope of the projects, testing and analysis can cover a number of platforms so that we can verify the logic of the programs in detail while ensuring that we meet the requirements of the company.

You will have to :

  • Analyze, define and translate functional and technical specifications into test requirements
  • Design and develop automated tests compatible with the internal testing framework and/or tools.
  • Design and develop test cases for the various components of the system, of the application under development or of the database.
  • Work in collaboration with the Product Owner and the Squad to prioritize the test ‘stories’
  • Attend Agile project ceremonies to report on the status of tests, communicate problems, implement QA standards and policies and communicate the QA schedule
  • Ensure that customer needs are met with the highest quality
  • Manage and coordinate end-to-end testing activities for projects
     
Qualifications

You are : 

  • A good communicator (oral and written) in French and English 
  • A team player with an analytical mind and attention to details 
  • Able to establish priorities, manage them and readjust yourself in case of change 
  • Persevering and have problem-solving skills 
  • Curious and interested to learn new tools
  • Available to work occasionally outside normal business hours (weekends, etc.), during deployments

You have :

  • Bachelor\'s or DEC in a field related to IT or any other combination of experience and related training deemed relevant
  • Minimum of 4 years of experience in test automation (backend)
  • In-depth knowledge of test automation and test development tools
  • Knowledge of programming software applications and/or system
  • Knowledge of database test programming.
  • Proficiency in the Python and/or Java programming language
  • A good understanding of the CI / CD concept
  • A good knowledge of JIRA (Test plugin)

Assets : 

  • Knowledge of the insurance industry 
  • Knowledge of analytical data tools
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team : 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits.  We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. 

#hybrid
 
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs. 

Background Checks

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us.  We want Intact to be a great place to work!  This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

Internal Candidates

For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

Eligibility to Work in Canada

It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made.  You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.
Referral Bonus

This role is eligible for employee referral bonus. #myReferrals3000

item.title: Senior Security Advisor, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Hiring manager: Philippe Audet

THE ROLE:

  • Identify security events that need to be monitored;
  • Advise and support DevOps and development teams in all development phases;
  • Ensure the development, implementation and automation of key risk metrics / indicators to
  • systematically measure and report information risks;
  • Identify and classify the risks then propose mitigations or remedies on the risks;
  • Analyze the risks associated with the various possible solutions and propose a security solution to the
  • operational problem that offers a fair balance between the potential losses and the cost of the
  • solution;
  • Identify gaps in IT compliance control and oversee documentation, implementation and testing for the
  • IT compliance control portfolio for the Lab
  • Monitor the latest industry trends and, where appropriate, proactively suggest the introduction of new
  • security practices and technologies; (automation, implementation, etc.)
  • Perform or coordinate application security tests for project teams;
  • Interpret the results of application security tests (code scanning, application intrusions, etc.);
  • Inform, educate and coach the development teams with regard to the norms, standards, methods and
  • tools of application security development
  • Manage and communicate the various security reports to Intactlab executives
  • Follow up and put processes in place to ensure that various security-related flaws are corrected within
  • the prescribed timeframe
  • Represent the Lab in the various processes that require knowledge of security
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • University degree in information security or equivalent experience;
  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in the field of information technology, more specifically in
  • technology and information security;
  • Safety certification would be an asset.
  • Requirements:
  • Strong knowledge of web application security principles and practices;
  • Experience in a DevSecOps - CI / CD environment;
  • Good understanding of common web and cloud application security vulnerabilities and exploitation
  • techniques from sources such as SANS, OWASP Top 10 and Cloud Security Alliance (CSA);
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, in French and English;
  • Sound ethical principles and an understanding of business ethics and information security

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits.  We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. 
 
Closing Statement

item.title: Data Scientists & AI Developers Interns – Hong Kong, Intact Lab
item.description:
Calling all students interested in AI and machine learning! We have several fantastic opportunities for AI Developer Interns and Data Scientist Interns to join our team. We are looking for interns who can commit to a minimum of 3 months during 

  • Summer (May to August)
  • Fall (September to December)
  • Winter (January to May)

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab, located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park is turning this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI
 
About the role

As a tech pioneer within a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Use machine learning and advanced statistics to help build innovative solutions for real-life customer and business problems
  • Explore new technologies to use in your own solutions
  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design
  • Transform data into meaningful conclusions and recommendations
  • Validate the scientific methodology and project outputs of the other team members
  • Collaborate with our teams in HK & Canada to share knowledge, learnings, results, and tools 
  • All this plus great work-life balance!
Qualifications

Data Scientist Intern - Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science, AI mathematics, engineering, statistics, science,  or a related field. 
  • Relevant experience in predictive modelling, machine learning and advanced statistics solving business problems is an asset
  • Knowledge of the underlying theory and implementation details of machine learning techniques such as clustering, decision trees, neural networks, Linear and Non-Linear Programming, Deep Learning (ANN, RNN, CNN) and Reinforcement Learning
  • Experience with our tech stack is an asset: scikit-learn, xgboost, pytorch, tensorflow, LightGBM, pandas, numpy
  • Programming experience in languages such as Python or R 
  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo
  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach
  • Excellent communication, organization and a collaborative attitude

AI Developer Intern - Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • Currently enrolled in a post-seconddary degree in computer science, software engineering, AI or a related discipline
  • Experience with Python or other language such as Java, C++, C#, etc 
  • Knowledge of our tech stack: Flask, MongoDB, Kafka, ElasticSearch 
  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo
  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach
  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills
  • If you don’t have experience in AI, a strong desire to immerse yourself in this exciting field
     
Closing Statement

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s moving into a new, exciting project or taking a leadership role in either managerial or technical path, your career will always be on the move.

item.description:

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

About the role

Do you think product development is like a team sport? Do you enjoy teamwork and think we can achieve greater things together than as individuals? Have the ability to secure everyone’s collaboration to achieve our business objectives? Are you a motivator and a servant leader who thinks accomplishing a project is more important than individual accomplishments? A really good listener, ready to mould a process that serves people and the product? Great! You are the person we are looking for!

Your mission:

  • Responsible for leading, planning and executing all aspects of RSA policy integration with Intact Lab’s digital applications.
  • Define target areas, inclusions and exclusions, high-level budget envelope, high-level timeline, cost estimate and cost management. 
  • Manage changes and priorities associated with changes to our digital applications for the RSA project. 
  • Work closely with the Product Owners of the Lab’s various digital applications, Managers, Architects, and other stakeholders to ensure strategy and execution alignment.
  • Work closely with the Quality Assurance Manager to define and monitor the testing strategy for the RSA project.
  • Lead all IT project management activities (staffing needs, budget, risks, audit requests, performance, security, PMO requirements, etc.) related to the RSA project.
  • Manage all required communications such as “Steering Committee”, “Management”, etc., as well as other stakeholders to keep everyone informed of what is going on, summarize the overall project planning and also allow for decisions to be made regarding specific project situations (issues/obstacles, contingencies, subject alignment, continuous improvement, etc.).
Qualifications

You are:

  • Bilingual
  • Passionate about creating software products.
  • Driven by challenges.
  • Creative, curious and ingenious.
  • A change agent who is not afraid to challenge the status quo.
  • Excellent at making complex ideas accessible to a variety of partners and audiences.
  • Organized, proactive and able to drive change.
  • Comfortable working in a constantly changing technological environment.

You have:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Software Engineering, or any equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • At least 5 years of project management experience.
  • Strong experience delivering products in Agile/Scrum mode in software engineering.
  • PMP certification is an asset.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package

  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits. Once it’s safe to do so, we will move to a hybrid approach which will give everyone the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. Schedules will be determined in partnership between individuals, managers, and the team.

item.title: Data Engineering Developer, Intact Lab
item.description:
​

Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Hiring Manager: Ionut Calacean

Data is the most important asset in today’s competitive world. We are the Data and Analytics department of the largest P&C insurer in Canada. Our mission is: “Accelerate our data advantage by bringing to user analytical data ready to be consumed, at a proper level of trust and security”.

Our team is using modern concepts, tools and technologies for data ingestion, acquisition and data consumption and work with Agile framework. We are structured into small, highly productive squads and working very close with the Data Lab team composed of Actuaries and Data Scientists.

You dream of exciting challenges? Join our team as a Data Engineering Developer and contribute to the planning and execution of data pipelines for various machine learning projects.

You will:

  • Design, implement, and maintain large-scale batch and real-time scalable data pipelines with complex data transformations;
  • Perform data wrangling to transform and map data from raw data forms into formats more appropriate and valuable for analytics;
  • Write and optimize complex queries on large data sets;
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements;
  • Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs;
  • Experience working with business teams to translate functional requirements into technical requirements;
  • Conduct business and functional requirements gathering and provide projects estimates;
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment;
  • Develops workflows and tools that automate data loading processes and help ensure data quality and integrity.
Qualifications

You are:

  • Motivated and autonomous, you  love learning and applying new technologies to solve complex problems;
  • Eager to understand how the business works and how your work impacts the business;
  • Comfortable working in complex environments and multidisciplinary teams;
  • Fast learner, versatile and a good team player;
  • Excellent communicator with good analytical skills.

You have:

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering or equivalent;
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis (ingestion and consumption);
  • Hands-on experience with leading commercial Cloud platforms, including AWS and Azure;
  • Excellent Python and PySpark skills;
  • Strong experience with Apache Spark (Databricks or similar), Kafka and NiFi;
  • Hands-on experience with Snowflake or Redshift, or similar cloud storage technologies;
  • Hands on experience with Hadoop distributions (Cloudera, Hortonworks) and Hive;
  • Strong experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases like PostgreSQL, Oracle, Cassandra, Mongo DB;
  • Experience with ElasticSearch and Kibana is a big plus;
  • Experience with Alation and/or other data catalog tools (Azure, Informatica) is a big plus;
  • Experience with Kubernetes, Docker is a big plus;
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies; 
  • Strong presentation, facilitation, verbal and written communication skills, including interpersonal skills.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • Flexibility in how and where you work

item.title: Director, Head of Portfolio Analytics, Capital Markets
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

As a member of the OMERS Capital Markets (OCM) team in Toronto, Ontario, reporting to the Senior Managing Director, Head of Business Operations, you will lead the Portfolio Analytics team and lead a transformation of how Capital Markets improves investment decision making through data driven insights. This is a high impact role requiring a hybrid of strategic and tactical orientation for problem solving. The Portfolio Analytics team will play a critical role in evolution of the OCM data management and analytics programs.


You will foster close collaborative partnerships with business stakeholders in Capital Markets, Finance, Operations, Data & Technology to understand business needs and how to apply data and analytical techniques to increase scale and operational efficiency, enhance self-service capabilities and improve scalability.


As a Director, you will consistently demonstrate team leadership, including sound judgment and timely, well-reasoned decision-making skills. You will help foster an engaged and collaborative team culture that is focused on investment results, innovation, mutual respect, and diverse thinking. An ideal candidate is one with an ability to work in a high-paced, dynamic environment with a strong ability to manage and balance business priorities across cross functional groups.

As a Director, Head of Portfolio Analytics OCM, you will be responsible for:

  • Develop and lead an analytics program for Capital Markets by delivering on a multi-year data strategy in collaboration with business & technology stakeholders
  • Build and lead a team comprising of data scientists, developers and functional experts to improve data quality, deliver analytics products that aid Investment decision making as well as providing insights & analytics not available previously
  • Provide strategic direction, leadership, coaching & performance management for the team and be accountable for delivering tangible business value
  • Collaborate across teams to solve business problems using analytics
  • Build effective relationships across Capital Markets, Risk, Investment Operations & Analytics (IOA), Data & Technology teams in OMERS
  • Improving data quality for example by mapping data lineage
  • Leading an agile product delivery approach for rapid prototyping and delivery of custom solutions
  • Enable & empower teams across OCM with key analytics products ensuring high data quality, reliability and availability
  • Provide thought-leadership to OCM Leadership as well as business teams on the “Art of Possible” as well as identifying opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Enabling the realization of Capital Market strategic objectives and business value through the development of a data strategy, roadmap, and implementation plan in alignment with strategies and policies of OMERS
  • Delivering data and analytics tools and solutions to OCM and its data consumers in alignment with their business needs and priorities, engaging resources as needed from Data & Technology, and data teams embedded in the business
  • Developing, deploying, and operationalizing relevant data science applications and supporting tools and processes
  • Supporting data science applications, integrated tools/processes, security, performance monitoring, change management, and process adjustments during implementation
  • Creating analytical models, conducting training, validating, testing, reconciling and data integrity maintenance
  • Delivering operational and service excellence, especially in support of OCM operational and calendar-driven priorities
  • Engaging with the wider OMERS community of similar practitioners to contribute to and benefit from emerging data analytics technologies and techniques
  • Contribute to the wider objectives and success of OCM and OMERS through collaboration and participation in initiatives.


Competencies:

  • Practical knowledge of a trading lifecycle in capital markets such as investment decision making, trade booking, execution, settlement and portfolio financial reporting
  • Knowledge of typical capital market focus areas such as data governance, risk frameworks, ESG Reporting etc
  • Although not essential, knowledge of capital markets topics such as portfolio construction, portfolio performance attribution and enterprise risk management is beneficial
  • Extensive hands-on technical experience with strong knowledge of analytics and associated use cases pertaining to analytics techniques, data management and product development approaches and lifecycles ideally in a capital markets or investment context
  • Problem solver, with demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions, leveraging data and technology
  • Demonstrated ability to lead a team and manage changes involving complex organizational structures and system changes
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Creative, flexible thinker who enjoys exploring new ideas
  • Ability to work in a high energy, fast pace environment with multiple professional perspectives
  • Ability to work with a diverse range of people, and to cultivate strong working relationships across various functional areas (Investments, Operations, Risk and Finance)
  • Experience with leading data governance and information management initiatives.


To succeed in this role, you bring the following:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Analytics, or any other quantitative field. A post graduate degree is an asset
  • 8+ years of experience working in a capital markets environment such as a front office, operations (back office) and/or finance (middle office) within the financial services industry
  • Experience of leading analytics & technology teams ideally within a Capital Markets or Financial Services domain.
  • Familiarity with international capital markets and different asset classes
  • Experience with financial tools or software (e.g. Bloomberg)
  • Experience with / Knowledge of cloud architecture and iPaaS tools for Integration
  • Hands-on technical expertise and aptitude in building analytics models and tools including dashboards that aid in investment decision making or solve a business problem
  • Practical experience developing and implementing advanced data analytics (such as machine learning, AI, natural language processing) and building an analytics practice
  • Proficiency in working with financial data, related alternative datasets, unstructured and non-traditional data
  • Proficiency in data science tools such as R and Python, and experience with implementing cloud based big data and analytics platforms
  • The ability to build relationships and influence across a diverse group of stakeholders (including senior level) across different enterprise units
  • Experience of facilitating sessions, helping participants reach decisions and accomplish goals
  • Polished communication and presentation skills. Experience in presenting to and communicating with senior business and technology leaders
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks would be beneficial, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark MLib, Theano or Caffe
  • Exposure to data modeling, data architecture, data engineering, data analysis and data science (familiarity with ETL tools, data warehousing and big data architecture and cloud constructs)
  • A passion around learning new technologies and analytical techniques with a proven track record
  • Team player with a “can do” attitude and willingness to help others for broader Team success.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Analyst, Valuation & Analytics
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

Oxford is seeking an analyst to join our Valuations & Analytics team in Toronto, Canada. Oxford’s Valuations & Analytics team is responsible for real estate valuations, portfolio and property performance and risk analysis across all markets that Oxford invests. The Analyst’s primary responsibilities include building and maintaining Oxford valuation models on a quarterly and annual basis. The candidate for this position will be exposed to the valuation and asset management analytics of investment properties across Oxford’s global portfolio.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Create and update valuation models primarily using Argus Enterprise;
  • Once per year, participate in the creation of Argus models to reflect the new operating budgets for each property, review and collate all new NOI and values for the portfolio;
  • Once per quarter, input all necessary updates for valuation models, including leasing and market assumptions as required;
  • Prepare annual written valuation reports;
  • Conduct analysis in support of Oxford’s Real Estate Management team for the impact on property values for various leasing and capital investment decisions;
  • Assist with internal and external appraisal processes;
  • Liaise with accountants, asset managers, leasing and property management groups in data collection for periodic valuation updates;
  • Data gathering and analysis to support assumptions used in valuations models;
  • Conduct market and economic research, assemble and interpret macro-market trends; and
  • Maintain database on valuation trends and parameters in various markets across Canada, the US, Europe and Asia.

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Relevant undergraduate or advanced degree, including Commerce, Finance, Real Estate or Urban Planning;
  • 0-2 years of fill-time work experience;
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (financial modeling) is required;
  • Current enrollment or demonstrated interest in pursuing AACI, CFA or CBV designation is desirable;
  • Prior work experience in a real estate company, appraisal or asset management firm, or a professional real estate advisory firm an asset;
  • Knowledge and experience with ARGUS Enterprise considered an asset;
  • Knowledge and experience with data visualization or business intelligence software is considered an asset;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail;
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, verbal and written communication, problem solving  and project management skills;
  • Ability to work well under pressure with multiple competing deadlines;
  • Flexible attitude towards a variety of work tasks as is required in a small working group,
  • Work effectively in a team environment and independently as required; and
  • Valid Passport for International travel as needed

To ensure your application is submitted to our applicant tracking system accurately, please follow the instructions below.

Please include all required documents (Resume, Cover Letter) in one combined file. Your application may be submitted in PDF of Microsoft Word format.

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Data Governance Specialist
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Data Governance Specialist works as part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team to support the implementation of new data governance tools and related processes, with a focus on enterprise data cataloging, metadata management, business workflows and data quality management.

This role will work closely with the Business teams and other Data & Technology partners to ensure data governance standards, policies and best practices are understood and applied consistently across the organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand OMERS business functions, activities, and transactions, as well as standard information and data governance best practices to contribute practical solutions for both structured and unstructured data in the development and implementation of the Data Governance Program

  • Design, develop and monitor technology solutions around key data governance focus areas of data catalog, metadata management, data quality management, data lineage business workflows and access management

  • Partner with Enterprise Data Governance Managers and Data Stewards to define and instrument metadata capture and storage for the CDE’s, evolve our enterprise business glossary, and facilitate the linkage between business definitions and the underlying technical metadata

  • Manage the processes around metadata repositories (data dictionary, business glossary) and data classification process (identification of sensitive data)

  • Perform data profiling, data quality analysis and the development of data quality rules to support monitoring and remediation activities

  • Refine and implement the enterprise metadata management framework, inclusive of business, operational and technical metadata

  • Provide ongoing access, maintenance, usage, and technical support for our Data Governance Tool inventory including Collibra, Azure Purview

  • Contribute to the development of reporting requirements to monitor data compliance as well as KPIs and metrics to gauge the health and maturity of data governance program

  • Collaborate with business and D&T partners to find opportunities to improve data accuracy and ensure that data owners are accountable for remediation

  • Contribute to the development of appropriate materials, conducting training sessions and be the change advocates to drive data governance best practices

  • Provide inputs on the design and development of data models for data warehousing and cataloging projects

  • Work closely with Data & Technology team during the development of new information and data governance related applications, including requirements validation and testing

  • Primary point of contact for business partners to resolve data security & access issues

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, math or a field related to information, data management, analytics or financial services.

  • 3 - 5 years of technical experience in implementing data governance, data analytics or data quality tools

  • Knowledge and expertise in data governance technology, business process modeling, metadata, data lineage, data classification, data quality and enterprise implementation of data governance tools and solutions

  • Experience in defining and building enterprise data management policies, processes, solutions, and associated documentation to strengthen data management

  • Experience with SQL, database applications MS SQL/ Oracle, and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau

  • Understanding of Cloud, Big Data technologies, architectural concepts - data lake, data warehouse, relational databases, data ingestion, ETL etc.

  • Hand’s on experience with tools such as Ataccama, Collibra, Informatica EIC/ BDM/BDQ, IBM IGC/ IA/ DQS, Microsoft Purview or similar

  • Knowledge and understanding of data regulations, privacy, ethical use, data sharing, critical data indicators, access management and data masking techniques

  • Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams

  • A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Director of Data Platforms and Engineering
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

The Data & Analytics team at Oxford Properties Group is looking for a brilliant Data Platforms & Engineering Director to design, build and deploy foundational data services, empowering teams all across Oxford with trusted, relevant, and reliable data.


The Data team supports Oxford business groups in defining data strategies and setting standards on how data is accessed, produced, and consumed across the organization. You will partner with a multitude of technical and business stakeholders to deliver technology that shapes the key role data plays in each of our business activities, with a focus on shepherding the quality, reliability, and accessibility of data. You will cultivate and grow a high-performing team powering a wide range of data services from production-facing to BI applications.


Our Data Platform and Machine Learning Platforms are built on top of the latest Microsoft Azure data, analytics & ML technologies, as well as industry-standard Data Quality and Integration services such as Ataccama and Boomi.


Commercial Real Estate is a $200 Trillion industry - larger than the public equities and bond market combined - and yet is only just being disrupted by data and technology. This opens a phenomenal opportunity for you to develop thought leadership, redefining how the real estate industry unlocks value from data.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Lead, develop, and grow an excellent multi-disciplinary Data team, working with the Senior Director of Data & Analytics
  • Develop, drive and implement an industry-leading data strategy for Oxford
  • Cultivating positive relationships amongst Director & VP+ business partners and champion organisational practices and changes ensuring data is treated as an asset
  • Champion and push to mature Oxford’s data culture, working jointly with the Analytics and Data Science team to promote a safe environment for innovation and experimentation, backed up with data, to unlock new value for Oxford
  • Drive the roadmap, technology selection, and direction for Oxford’s Data Platform and deliver against a prioritised backlog of use cases helping teams across Oxford integrate, process, and consume Data at scale
  • Work closely with our Analytics and Data Science team to drive the roadmap, seamless integration and direction of Oxford’s Machine Learning platform and empower Data Scientists and BI analysts at Oxford with trusted, timely and reliable data in support of their use cases
  • Work with Oxford business users to identify key opportunities to transform and simplify our processes by building, testing, managing, and maintaining data pipelines radically simplifying and standardizing internal data consumption use cases as well as data-sharing with third party partners
  • Evolve our data ownership model by working closely with key Business, Technology and Enterprise Architecture partners and champion a culture of data quality and stewardship across the organisation
  • Bring in thought leadership and work closely with Enterprise Architecture, Advanced Analytics & Data Privacy teams at both Oxford and OMERS to guide our data, analytics & information policies and guidelines
  • Provide input into our application transformation and/or decommissioning strategy, aligned with our Data strategy & ownership model
  • Define and deliver an engineering-first approach to data quality and data governance against a prioritized backlog of automated data governance services
  • Evaluate external vendors and inform buy vs build decisions in line with our vision and strategy for Data

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • 8-10 years’ experience or progressively increasing management responsibility roles in data engineering and/or related software engineering
  • People management experience with a proven track record of developing and recruiting top data and cloud engineering talent (experience managing and working within globally distributed teams a strong plus)
  • Solid knowledge of building cloud-native data platforms leveraging Microsoft Azure technologies and opinionated proposals on what a good technology and team set up looks like, based on specific organisational needs
  • An ambition to drive systemic change, shifting Oxford’s approach to data and advocating for initiatives that will increase our maturity as an organisation, backed up with a well-articulated delivery plan for your team and key stakeholders
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to speak the language of both business and technology folks in order to drive the right outcomes for Oxford
  • A strategic mindset, with the ability to influence VP+ level stakeholders in order to drive adoption and accelerate delivery of data & analytics projects
  • Solid knowledge of modern software development practices, including CI/CD within the context of data (Git, Azure DevOps, Release management – familiarity with MLOps practices a strong plus)
  • A passion for data quality paired up with in-depth expertise about what needs to be done to accelerate data maturity at Oxford
  • Experience of working with Data Science teams and a working knowledge of various ML technologies (familiarity with AzureML a strong plus)
  • Working knowledge of data modelling and information classification and security standards at an enterprise level
  • Proven experience of working within an agile environment and cross-functional delivery teams

You will stand out if you have:

  • Previous experience of working in Commercial Real Estate and familiarity with industry-specific data ontologies such as RealEstateCore
  • Familiarity or interest in the PropTech landscape and digital buildings technologies
  • A voice and presence at industry meet ups, communities, and events
  • Experience of working in larger organisations with a combination of legacy and cloud technologies, supporting migration and/or transformation projects

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

item.title: Information Risk & Compliance Analyst
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

We are looking for a motivated Information Risk and Compliance Analyst to join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics (DNA) team within OMERS\' Data & Technology. DNA applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable and appropriately governed solutions that drive sustainable growth at OMERS.

In this role, you will will develop and nurture strong relationships with key governance partners (including Risk, Compliance, Audit, Legal, Privacy, Cybersecurity) and OMERS business units to identify applicable laws, regulations and industry standards governing the handling of records and data.  You will also develop, implement and maintain key processes and controls for complying with those requirements, such as data retention and disposition processes. In doing so, you will directly strengthen our compliance practices, manage risks to our organization and help optimize the ability of data to support a diverse array of global business functions.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Understanding the function, location and ownership of records/data across the OMERS enterprise and updating inventories, metadata repositories and other tools necessary to enable an enterprise-wide retention and disposition program.
  • Researching laws, rules and regulations impacting the records retention, including the duration, location and manner for keeping records across in legal jurisdictions from across the globe.
  •  Maintaining a network of business area representatives with accountability and ownership for records retention and disposition decision-making, as well as points of contact for records/data inquiries and issue resolution requests.
  • Developing and maintain procedures and workflow processes necessary to support efficient, compliant management of records and data in line with best practices, laws and regulations.
  • Working with information management and technology team members to implement a new Enterprise Data Retention Standard by applying retention categories and rules in electronic content management solutions and structured data systems.
  • Coordinating a legally defensible data disposition program applicable to physical records, electronic documents and structured data.
  • Apply record hold and discovery processes in response to litigation, claims, audits, investigations, personal information access requests and other legal proceedings.
  • Developing and implementing an Enterprise Archives program, including establishment of archival selection criteria for physical records, electronic content and structured data.
  • Drive a culture of compliance, risk management and innovation by delivering records and data-related training, awareness and enablement programs.

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Degree or diploma in Archives, Information Studies, Library and Information Science, Law, Compliance or Policy Management AND/OR relevant professional certification, such as Certified Records Manager (CRM), Certified Records Analyst (CRA) or Information Governance Professional (IGP).
  • 3-5 years experience developing and implementing records/data retention, disposition and archival preservation controls.
  • Solid grasp of records/data retention, disposition, legal holds, archival preservation, content management systems and information governance standards and best practices.
  • Experience identifying and assessing legal/regulatory requirements impacting the handling of records and data.
  • Experience using and applying data and information governance controls to electronic systems, such as structured databases, electronic records management systems and content management systems.
  • Ability to build relationships and facilitate discussion across a diverse group of stakeholders from different business units.
  • Demonstrated experience in project and time management.
  • Advanced analytical skills, including the ability to interpret and apply complex legal language, industry standards and policy statements.
  • Polished written communication and dynamic presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization.
  • Experience automating or enhancing records and data management processes through the use of technology is an asset.
  • Experience working in the finance, pensions, investments or commercial real estate sectors is an asset.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.
